predicate.note: Frames file for 'squeeze' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entries knead-26.5, wipe_manner-10.4.1, funnel-9.3; other framed members include: beat, quash, shake, wind; trim; dump, push, shake. No explicit comparison.

example.name: transitive
example.text: Airlines also say their frequent-flier programs are squeezing profits because awards are being redeemed at a heavier-than-normal rate.
example.arg: because awards are being redeemed at a heavier-than-normal rate

roleset.name: extract or insert by means of pressure

example.name: squeeze out of
example.text: But it's hard *trace* to squeeze much profit out of the personal-computer business these days, and the workstation market, while important, is too small to rely on for much growth.

example.name: misparsed squeeze out of
example.text: Norman Berry, the creative executive who *trace* was apparently squeezed out of Ogilvy & Mather in June, is returning to Ogilvy's parent company, WPP Group PLC.

example.name: squeeze from
example.text: John can squeeze blood from turnips.

example.name: squeeze into
example.text: ``Fast-food franchisers have managed [*-1] to squeeze in stores into every corner available.''

roleset.name: reduce

role.descr: End point, end state of arg1

example.name: stupid stock reports again
example.text: These and other problems squeezed Federal's profit margins last year to 8%, down from more than 13% annually in the first half of the decade.
example.arg: more than 13% annually in the first half of the decade

roleset.note: Sorta nasty compromise on the "down from" phrase.
